DataElement.preferredName: Adult Trail Making Test Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age._A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age._A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A human who has reached reproductive age.

Concepts.definition: An age group comprised of humans who have reached reproductive age.

Property.preferredDefinition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets.  It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.

Concepts.definition: A neuropsychological test of visual attention and task switching that requires a subject to connect a sequence of 25 consecutive targets. It provides an easy to administer and reliable assessment of attention, sequencing, cognition, visual search, and motor function.
